title: How to Use AirPods with a Peloton Exercise Bike

steps.title: AirPods won’t work with your Peloton if they’re already paired.
steps.content: AirPods won’t work with your Peloton if they’re already paired. If they’re currently connected to your phone, computer, or another device, go into the Bluetooth settings on the device. Select your AirPods from the list of paired devices, then disconnect them. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Log into your Peloton device, if you haven’t already.
steps.content: Log into your Peloton device, if you haven’t already. Look for the menu button … in the bottom right corner of the home screen, then tap it. A menu will pop up on the right side of the screen. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Look close to the bottom of the menu.
steps.content: Look close to the bottom of the menu. You should see an option labeled Device Settings . Tap it to open a new menu screen. [3] X Research source

steps.title: It will appear under Wireless & networks.
steps.content: It will appear under Wireless & networks . Tap Bluetooth to open the Bluetooth settings menu. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Check whether Bluetooth is enabled already.
steps.content: Check whether Bluetooth is enabled already. If not, tap the toggle button on the top right side of the screen to turn it on. Once you’ve turned on Bluetooth, the word On should appear at the top left side of the screen. [5] X Research source hhttps://support.apple.com/en-us/HT208718

steps.title: Make sure the lid of the case is open.
steps.content: Make sure the lid of the case is open. Open the AirPods case. This will allow your AirPods to connect with the Peloton.

steps.title: Wait until status light flashes white.
steps.content: Wait until status light flashes white. Once it does, your AirPods should be in pairing mode. [6] X Research source You may need to hold the button for 3-5 seconds.

steps.title: It should appear once the AirPods are in pairing mode.
steps.content: It should appear once the AirPods are in pairing mode. Make sure your Peloton is still displaying the Bluetooth settings screen. When you see AirPod appear in the list of available devices, close your AirPods’ case. [7] X Research source Tap AirPod on your Peloton screen to select it. After you select AirPod , you should see the device’s status in the list change to Paired .

steps.title: When you’re sure the AirPods are paired, hit the home button.
steps.content: When you’re sure the AirPods are paired, hit the home button. It’s located in the bottom center of the screen. This will take you back to the Peloton Featured page. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Take the AirPods out of the case and put them on.
steps.content: Take the AirPods out of the case and put them on. Select a ride or run with a music track and start it to make sure that you can hear the music through your AirPods. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Make sure your AirPods are charged and correctly connected.
steps.content: Make sure your AirPods are charged and correctly connected. If you’re having trouble getting the AirPods to connect or play music, there are a few simple troubleshooting techniques you can try: [10] X Research source Charge your AirPods completely if you think the batteries may be dead. [11] X Research source Turn Bluetooth off and on again in your Peloton settings, then try reconnecting. Double check that your AirPods aren’t connected to another device.

steps.title: Some AirPods are sweat resistant, but they still need proper care.
steps.content: Some AirPods are sweat resistant, but they still need proper care. AirPods Pro and 3rd Generation Airpods are built to hold up to a bit of moisture, so don’t worry about breaking a sweat during your Peloton workout. However, to keep your AirPods working properly, clean them after every ride or run. Wipe them with a soft, dry, lint-free cloth and let them air dry before using them again. [12] X Research source Never submerge your AirPods in water or expose them to soaps or detergents. Allow them to air dry, and don’t use heated or pressurized air to speed up the drying process.
